Description: Title of the position - Network Engineer Location - Hosur About The Business Tata Electronics Pvt. Ltd. is a prominent global player in the electronics manufacturing industry, with fast-emerging capabilities in Electronics Manufacturing Services, Semiconductor Assembly & Test, Semiconductor Foundry, and Design Services. Established in 2020 as a greenfield venture of the Tata Group, the company aims to serve global customers through integrated offerings across a trusted electronics and semiconductor value chain. With a rapidly growing workforce, the company currently employs over 65,000 people and has significant operations in Gujarat, Assam, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka, India. Tata Electronics is committed to creating a socioeconomic footprint by employing many women in its workforce and actively supporting local communities through initiatives in environment, education, healthcare, sports and livelihood. Role Overview As a Network Engineer , you will play a critical role in designing, configuring, and maintaining our network infrastructure to ensure security, performance, and reliability. You will work with cutting-edge technologies, troubleshoot complex issues, and contribute to a robust network environment that supports our global operations. Responsibilities 1. Firewall Configuration & Troubleshooting Configure and manage Palo Alto, Checkpoint, and FortiGate firewalls. Implement security policies, NAT configurations, and VPN setups (IPsec and SSL VPN). Troubleshoot issues related to traffic blocking, NAT, session management, and policy violations. Conduct routine security audits, policy reviews, and configure SSL decryption. 2. Wireless Access Points (Meraki & Catalyst) Set up Meraki and Catalyst wireless access points with multiple SSIDs, VLANs, and security settings. Troubleshoot connectivity, performance degradation, and interference issues. Optimize RF environments by adjusting channel and power configurations. Switching & Routing Configure and maintain Cisco, HPE, Nexus, Aruba, Arista, and Juniper switches and routers. Set up VLANs, trunking, EtherChannel, and Spanning Tree Protocol (STP). Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks to enhance network health. Monitor key performance metrics to ensure optimal network operation. 5. Security & Compliance Enforce firewall and network security policies per company and regulatory standards. Participate in network audits and security reviews. Contribute to disaster recovery and business continuity plans, including hot and cold standby solutions. 6. Documentation & Reporting Maintain detailed network diagrams, configuration records, and troubleshooting guides. Prepare reports on network performance, incidents, and changes for management. Title: Manager/Senior Network and Core Services Engineer
Description: Job Description: Senior Network and Core Services Engineer Role Summary The Senior Network and Core Services Engineer is responsible for the design, implementation, and 24/7 operation of critical core network services and security infrastructure. This role requires deep, hands-on expertise across multiple vendor platforms and open-source technologies essential for Carrier-Grade performance, regulatory compliance, and subscriber services, including large-scale NAT, DNS/NTP services, and high-volume security logging. This role focuses on ensuring high availability, performance, and security of services like IPDR, CG-NAT, DNS, and Load Balancing, while driving process improvements and acting as an escalation point for complex technical issues. Key Responsibilities Incident and Problem Management (L0-L3): Act as the final technical escalation point, performing deep-dive analysis, troubleshooting, and resolution for critical outages across the entire service delivery chain (Network, Applications, Security). System Maintenance and Health: Lead the administration, configuration, and maintenance of specialized Telco/Security platforms, including A10 CG-NAT, F5 BigIP (LTM/GTM), and Fortigate ADC/Firewall. Monitoring and Logging: Design, implement, and manage monitoring dashboards and alerts. Oversee the operation and optimization of the SGBox Log Management system for event correlation and security analysis. Security Operations: Monitor and respond to security events, perform vulnerability assessments, and ensure compliance with operational security policies (acting as a blended NOC/SOC function). Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs): Create, refine, and enforce SOPs and Methods of Procedure (MOPs) for routine maintenance, fault isolation, and disaster recovery scenarios. Team Leadership & Mentorship: Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior NOC/SOC analysts (L0/L1), conducting post-mortem analysis (RCA) and sharing knowledge to prevent recurring incidents. Architect, configure, and manage Carrier-Grade Network Address Translation (CGNAT) solutions on A10 Networks devices (e.g., Thunder Series) to support IPv4 address exhaustion, including LSN, DS-Lite, and advanced logging mechanisms Deploy, maintain, and troubleshoot the IP Detail Record (IPDR) or equivalent Open-Source logging solution for CGNAT session logging to ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements (Lawful Intercept/Data Retention). Manage the deployment and performance of DNS and Network Time Protocol (NTP) services, primarily utilizing F5 BIG-IP DNS (formerly GTM) for intelligent traffic steering and high availability Design and manage complex Application Delivery Controller (ADC) solutions and load-balancing services using F5 BIG-IP Local Traffic Manager (LTM), including VIPs, Pools, Monitors, iRules development, and SSL offloading. Configure, manage, and optimize FortiGate firewalls for network segmentation, high-speed security policies, VPN termination, and threat prevention. Integrate all core devices (A10, F5, FortiGate) with the SGBox platform for centralized Log Management and SIEM correlation. Develop custom parser rules, dashboards, reports, and correlation rules for proactive threat detection and compliance Utilize scripting (Python, Ansible) for configuration management, device provisioning, and log analysis automation across the multi-vendor environment. Key Skills and Qualifications:- Network & Core Telco CG-NAT Expert: Deep configuration and troubleshooting experience with A10 or similar platforms (Carrier-Grade NAT, LSN, D-DOS Protection). Load Balancing & ADC- F5-BigIP Expert: Advanced administration of LTM (Local Traffic Manager), GTM/DNS (Global Traffic Manager), iRules scripting, and high-availability setups. Security & Firewalls-Fortigate Strong experience with deployment, policy management, routing, and Application Delivery Controller (ADC) features. Logging & SIEM- SGBox Proficient in managing, querying, and configuring alert correlation rules within SGBox 2or a comparable SIEM/Log Management solution. Infrastructure Services-DNS / NTP Expert-level knowledge of BIND/ISC-DNS or similar, synchronization protocols, and their operational security in a large-scale environment. Data/Billing-IPDR Understanding of IP Detail Record (IPDR) generation, collection, and correlation for billing/lawful interception purposes. Operating Systems-Open Source Advanced proficiency in Linux (RHEL/CentOS/Ubuntu) for application/server management, scripting (Bash/Python), and service troubleshooting. Soft Skills:- Exceptional troubleshooting and analytical skills in a high-pressure, live-traffic environment. Strong ability to document and train NOC staff on new procedures and core system operations. Excellent communication skills for cross-functional collaboration (Legal, Engineering, NOC). Exceptional Communication: Clear and concise communication, both written and verbal, for technical documentation, incident updates, and stakeholder reporting. Critical Thinking & Problem Solving: Proven ability to quickly isolate root causes under high-pressure, critical incident situations (e.g., major network outages). Ownership and Accountability: Demonstrates a high degree of ownership over incidents from detection through final resolution (L3). Team Collaboration: Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Development, Security) and external vendors. Relevant Certifications Certifications from the primary OEM vendors are highly desirable: Vendor/Technology Recommended Certification Level A10 Networks (CGNAT) ACOS Certified Professional (ACP) or similar A10 certification. F5 Networks (ADC/DNS) F5 Certified BIG-IP Technical Specialist (CTS) LTM and DNS . Fortinet (Firewall) Fortinet NSE 4 (or higher, e.g., NSE 7) . Log Management SGBox Certified Specialist (or equivalent certification in a leading SIEM platform if SGBox specific training is unavailable). General Networking CCNP Service Provider or equivalent is a strong plus. NOC Management Requirements Shift Operations: Must be available to work in a 24x7 rotating shift environment as required to maintain continuous operational coverage. Escalation Management: Must be proficient in executing high-level escalations to vendor support (e.g., F5, A10, Fortinet) and managing internal C-Level communications during high-severity incidents. Performance Metrics: Experience working with and driving performance against key operational metrics (MTTR - Mean Time to Resolution, MTBF - Mean Time Between Failures, SLA compliance). Process Improvement: Ability to identify recurring issues and champion automation or process changes to eliminate manual, repetitive tasks Familiar with ticket lifecycle management, event correlation, and trouble ticket prioritization. Strong knowledge of incident severity classification, change advisory processes, and post-incident reviews. Exposure to automation and orchestration platforms for network fault and performance management. Ability to create and maintain dashboard views for real-time visibility of NOC/SOC performance metrics.

We’ve built India’s most founder-loved brand — and now, we want someone who can make it even louder online. We’re looking for an Associate, Social Media Marketing professional who’s built different — someone who scrolls till 3 AM, saves trends before they trend, and can smell a viral moment before it drops. Think of it as being part editor, part trend hunter, part chaos-architect. If you’ve ever thought “I could’ve done that post better,” this is your shot to prove it. Re-spin them for startups, founders, and the Razorpay universe. Write captions that sound like a person, not a press release. Drop memes, reels, and threads that get people talking. Be in brainstorms, and maybe on camera when the vibe’s right. Team up with editors and designers to turn ideas into scroll-stoppers. Use AI tools to draft, caption, remix, and move fast. Track what hits, tweak what doesn’t, and keep experimenting. Basically: keep Razorpay in people’s feeds and heads. Who You Probably Are 1–2 years into the game (college, freelance, meme page, side hustle — all good). You’ve made stuff — posts, reels, memes, edits — that actually worked. You live online: Reels, Shorts, Threads, Substack, maybe even Reddit. You get why something blows up, not just how. You write like a human and think like a creator. You’re comfortable being on-camera and unfiltered. You’re allergic to “corporate social media.” Bonus Points If You’ve grown a page, brand, or creator account. You’ve gone viral (or know exactly how you would). You know your way around CapCut, Canva, ChatGPT, Runway, OpusClip. You think “content calendar” is just a fancy word for “moment radar.” Why You’ll Love It You’ll be part of a small, dangerous team that runs one of India’s boldest brands. No approvals that kill ideas. No endless decks. Just ideas → edits → posts → feedback → do it again, better. If you’re hungry, restless, and obsessed with how the internet moves — come build the next wave of brand storytelling with us. Location : Bangalore (On-site, 5 days a week)

Title: Brand Designer

Working closely with the Design Manager and cross-functional partners, the Brand Designer will help elevate the brand’s design language, strengthen its visual consistency across touchpoints, and bring consumer-centric creativity into every project. Responsibilities Lead and manage the visual identity and design expression for assigned brands within the portfolio. Collaborate closely with senior design leaders, brand marketing teams, consumer insights, and global design partners. Develop compelling creative concepts, design scenarios, and visual solutions aligned with brand strategy. Participate in consumer research and translate insights into actionable design requirements. Drive final design recommendations and approvals, ensuring production-ready assets that meet brand, quality, and performance standards. Work with cross-functional teams to ensure design consistency across packaging, communication, and new product initiatives. Title: Graphic Designer
Description: About us: Jar is India’s leading Daily Saving app that helps people build strong saving habits—one small step at a time. Our goal is to make saving simple, rewarding, and truly life-changing. Founded in 2021 by Misbah Ashraf and Nishchay AG, Jar is a Bengaluru-based startup with one simple belief: saving a little every day in 24K Digital Gold can truly transform your future. Today, 20 million+ Indians trust Jar as their saving partner. With flexible saving options—Daily, Weekly, Monthly, and Instant Saving—we have made it easy for everyone to save in their own way and withdraw anytime. We are one of the leaders in UPI autopay transactions, crossing more than 1 million transactions per day. In 2023, we expanded our vision with Nek, our jewelry brand crafted to bring together luxury and affordability, it has since surpassed ₹100 crore in revenue. We have a big dream of bringing “Har Ghar Sona”. Small, consistent savings are just the start. We’re here to walk alongside our users, helping Indians secure their financial future every step of the way. Backed by Tiger Global Management, Arkam Ventures, and WEH Ventures, among others, we have raised $50 million+ in funding. In January 2025, we hit a huge milestone of becoming profitable. Now, we’re charging ahead, focused on sustainable growth and scaling impact. And this is just the beginning! What’s the role? As a Graphic Designer at Jar, you will play a key role in creating compelling visuals that represent our brand across various platforms. From product marketing to brand campaigns, you’ll work closely with our creative team to design and execute high-quality creatives that engage and inspire our audience. Familiarity with the Adobe Creative Suite is essential, and bonus points if you bring motion graphics skills to the table! What will be your responsibilities? Create visually appealing designs for digital and print media, including social media creatives, youtube thumbnails, performance ads and a lot more. Work on branding projects for sub-brands, marketing campaigns, partnerships, and product launches. Collaborate with the marketing and product teams to design and deliver creatives that align with our brand identity. Support the creation of motion graphics for videos, explainer videos, product flows, and campaigns (if applicable). Develop layouts and visual assets for presentations, pitch decks, and employer branding materials. Stay up-to-date with design trends and apply them to enhance the brand’s visual identity What’s required from you? 1-3 years of experience in graphic design, preferably in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects, Premiere Pro). Strong portfolio showcasing creative work in branding, social media, digital marketing, and product design. Knowledge of motion graphics and video editing is a plus. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Attention to detail, with a strong sense of typography, color theory, and layout. Ability to work on multiple projects and deliver quality work under tight deadlines. What makes us different? We’re not just building a product—we’re shaping the future of savings in India. We seek people who bring passion, energy, and fresh ideas to help us make that happen. Experience matters, but we are a potential first organisation. We move fast, learn from our mistakes, and take bold risks to solve problems that haven’t been attempted before. If you’re excited about working in an environment where people inspire and truly support each other, you’ve found the right fit. What do we stand for? The five values that we live by: Passion: At Jar, we strive to create an environment where people love what they do, are motivated and equipped to do their best work. Equality: We bring diverse skills, ideas, and experiences to the table, supporting and challenging each other across teams to create something bigger than ourselves. Growth: When our people grow, Jar grows. We create opportunities for learning, development, and meaningful impact. Accountability: The core of our work ethic is taking ownership of our work, showing initiative, and having the freedom to ask questions. Consistency: We believe in doing the right things consistently. Big change doesn’t happen overnight, it’s built one step at a time. Join us and let’s build something amazing together! What employee benefits do we have? Glad you asked! Among other things, we have Medical Insurance for employees and their families ESOPs allocation Pluxee meal card Swish club card for exclusive employee discounts Advance salary plans Relocation assistance L&D programmes

Title: copywriter
Description: what is CRED? CRED is an exclusive community for India’s most trustworthy and creditworthy individuals, where the members are rewarded for good financial behavior. CRED was born out of a need to bring back the focus on a long lost virtue, one of trust, the idea being to create a community centered around this virtue. a community that constantly strives to become more virtuous in this regard till they finally scale their behavior to create a utopia where being trustworthy is the norm and not the exception. to build a community like this requires a community of its own; a community special in its own way, working towards making this vision come true. here’s a thought experiment: what do you get when you put a group of incredibly passionate and driven people and entrust them with the complete freedom to chase down their goals in a completely uninhibited manner? answer: you get something close to what we have at CRED; CRED just has it better. visibility is easy. memorability is earned. at CRED, we build the latter. where words aren’t just written, they’re engineered to stay. they make people feel something. they make them think twice before settling for less. they shape decisions, sharpen products, and signal intent. we’re looking for someone who can lead that craft with clarity, taste, and conviction. what will you do: own CRED’s voice across the ecosystem: product, marketing, campaigns, comms. you’ll raise the standard, protect it, and evolve it actively shape the organisation’s understanding of language: how it drives perception, behaviour, and trust drive narratives for major launches: across app, films, brand campaigns, activations, and content platforms. the idea starts with you; the execution carries your fingerprints lead cross-functional storytelling: ensuring product, design, marketing, and PR speak with one voice and one level of intelligence architect communication frameworks for new products, verticals, and experiences. defend quality, articulate rationale, and negotiate for the time and space great work needs set up a culture of writing that’s bold, elegant, intelligent, and unmistakably CRED: across everything from a push notification to a brand film bring clarity in ambiguity: simplify the complex, challenge the obvious, and articulate intent without losing nuance you should apply if you: are someone who understands tone, semiotics, audience engineering, and the psychology behind how language moves people a thinker who knows the difference between humor and wit, and between confidence and noise a leader who can critique, elevate, and build someone who brings a point of view someone who can provide decisive feedback you’ve led creative or copy teams before, and elevated their quality through structure you can switch between executive conversations and craft conversations with ease you read widely, think deeply, and have a point of view on what excellent writing looks like in products, brands, and platforms how is life at CRED? working at CRED would instantly make you realize one thing: you are working with the best talent around you. not just in the role you occupy, but everywhere you go. talk to someone around you; most likely you will be talking to a singer, standup comic, artist, writer, an athlete, maybe a magician. at CRED people always have talent up their sleeves. with the right company, even conversations can be rejuvenating. at CRED, we guarantee a good company. hard truths: pushing oneself comes with the role. and we realise pushing oneself is hard work. which is why CRED is in the continuous process of building an environment that helps the team rejuvenate oneself: included but not limited to a stacked, in-house pantry, with lunch and dinner provided for all the team members, paid sick leaves and a comprehensive health insurance. to make things smoother and to make sure you spend time and energy only on the most important things, CRED strives to make every process transparent: there are no work timings because we do not believe in archaic methods of calculating productivity, your work should speak for you. there are no job designations because you will be expected to hold down roles that cannot be described in one word. since trust is a major virtue in the community we have built, we make it a point to highlight it in the community behind CRED: all our team members get their salaries before their joining date. a show of trust that speaks volumes because of the skin in the game. there are many more such eccentricities that make CRED what it is but that’s for one to discover. if you feel at home reading this, get in touch. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. Title: Content Writer (Social Media, E-Commerce & CRM)

The ideal candidate will understand both creative storytelling and data-driven communication, helping us engage customers, drive conversions, and build loyalty. Key Responsibilities Social Media * Write clear, concise and engaging copy for social media – paid and organic ads - hooks, posts, captions, and scripts tailored to each platform (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube). * Collaborate with design/video teams to develop thumb-stopping creatives. * Adapt content to trending formats (Reels, Shorts, Stories, Carousels). * Maintain consistent tone of voice while aligning with campaign goals. * Create campaign one-liners with potential of virality E-Commerce * Develop SEO-friendly product titles, descriptions, and bullet points for marketplaces (Amazon, Flipkart, etc.) and brand website. * Create A+ content / enhanced brand content for product listings. * Write promotional copy for website banners, landing pages, and campaigns/sale events * Ensure accuracy of product details and consistency across platforms. CRM (Email, SMS, WhatsApp Marketing) * Craft persuasive subject lines, body copy, and CTAs for CRM campaigns. * Personalize messaging for different audience segments (new users, repeat buyers, lapsed customers). * Align campaigns with lifecycle journeys (onboarding, promotions, retention, reactivation). * Collaborate with CRM team to A/B test and optimize copy for open/click rates. KPIs & Success Metrics * Engagement rates (likes, shares, comments, saves) on social media. * CTR & conversion rates on e-commerce listings and campaigns. * Open rates, CTR, and conversions for CRM campaigns. * Consistency in tone of voice and brand guidelines across all touchpoints. Title: Associate Editor
Description: Title: Associate Editor About the role: As an Associate Editor in the Editorial team, you will primarily be editing conference presentations and documents. You must possess editing skills and an eye for detail. A great fit for the role is a multi-tasker who can collaborate with different teams and stakeholders. The job requires an individual with good communication skills, a firm understanding of grammar and punctuation, ability to manage workflow, respect for timelines, and commitment to self-improvement and development. What you will do: Edit reports, conference presentations and time-sensitive deliverables. Format documents and prepare them for editing. Make changes to content (typically in Google Docs and Microsoft PowerPoint) using Gartner’s content management system. Raise queries for clarity and highlight inconsistencies in the document. Take initiative to check and confirm fact-based statements, statistics, and other content in written research, as necessary (e.g., verify company and product names, etc.) Work on additional projects as needed and demonstrate complete ownership of the tasks/projects. Undertake continuous, job-related training to maintain editorial quality levels and improve individual skills. What you will need: Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Liberal Arts or in other relevant discipline 0 to 3 years of editorial experience, preferably working for newspapers, magazines, or journals, in a busy environment that is deadline driven. Editorial experience with a newspaper/publication would be an added advantage. Good command over the English language, including grammar and punctuation. Knowledge of AP Style Guide would be an added advantage. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Collaborative attitude and no-limits learning mindset. Capable of delivering error-free and consumable content. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with others. Ability to understand and quickly adapt to new processes, best practices and changes to style. Working knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint, as well as their Google equivalents. Ability to handle pressure and stress without compromising quality. Detail-oriented approach to work with good organization skills. Problem-solving mindset and a willingness to take the initiative while mitigating risks. Who are we? At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world. Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities. Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. Title: Copywriter
Description: Designation: Creative Strategist Job Description Major Roles & Responsibilities: Carry out creative duties on multiple brands from different industries ranging from campaign planning and ideation to scriptwriting and copywriting. Work with the New Business team on all creative ideation and a creative showcase for any pitch. Present the entire creative plan for any campaign or narration of any script to clients on any brand. Ensure the creative work is up to an award-winning standard and follow up by applying for various awards to bring recognition to the team. Report to the Creative Lead who will provide overall direction, feedback, and references for campaigns or other creative tasks. Ability to develop and propose value-added, creative interactive strategies and presentations for pitches to convert clients. Knowledge of industry trends and competitor offerings. Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Creative Suite. Understanding of target audience and ability to create content that appeals to them. Knowledge of moment marketing campaigns and ability to propose topical content and campaigns proactively based on trending conversations relevant to the target audience.

Title: IRRBB
Description: What impact will you make? Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. As the undisputed leader in professional services, Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential. The Team Deloitte SRT helps entities mitigate risk while discovering new opportunities to create value. Our end-to-end risk services span all domains, from managing strategic risks in the C-Suite to improving board oversight, and from balancing financial and environmental policies to addressing cyber threats. Work you’ll do In our team you’ll build and nurture positive working relationships with teams and clients with the intention to exceed client expectations. You’ll: Gather & translate requirements – Work with risk officers, treasury, finance, and regulators to elicit, analyse, and document functional and non‑functional requirements for IRRBB calculations, producing user stories, process flows, and gap analyses. Design techno‑functional solutions – Create data‑model mappings and end‑to‑end data‑flow diagrams that link core‑banking, treasury, and market‑data feeds to the IRRBB analytics engine (repricing, earnings‑at‑risk, economic‑value‑of‑equity). SQL development & optimisation – Write complex SQL queries (CTE, window functions, pivot/unpivot) to extract, transform, and load large banking datasets; develop stored procedures, views, and validation scripts; tune performance for millions of rows. Risk‑model implementation & validation – Support the build, back‑testing, stress‑testing, and documentation of IRRBB models; produce validation and audit artefacts for internal and regulator review. Reporting & dashboarding – Build automated regulatory and management dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) using SQL‑driven data feeds; ensure timely delivery of reporting packs and exception alerts. Stakeholder collaboration & agile delivery – Act as the bridge between risk, finance, treasury, and IT; participate in sprint planning, daily stand‑ups, and retrospectives; facilitate workshops and training on IRRBB concepts and tools. Continuous improvement – Identify data‑quality gaps, propose enhancements to valuation methodologies, and drive automation of IRRBB processes to increase efficiency and control efficacy. Business analysis: Elicit, document, and translate functional and non‑functional requirements into user stories, process flows, and gap‑analysis reports for risk‑management initiatives. SQL & data engineering: Write and optimise complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and validate large banking datasets; develop stored procedures, views, and ETL scripts. Techno‑functional design: Create data‑model mappings between core banking, treasury, and risk‑analytics platforms; design end‑to‑end data flows for IRRBB calculations (repricing, earnings‑at‑risk, economic‑value‑of‑equity). Risk modelling & validation: Support implementation, back‑testing, stress‑testing, and documentation of IRRBB models; produce validation and audit artefacts for internal and regulator review. Reporting & visualisation: Build automated regulatory and management dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) using SQL‑driven data feeds; ensure timely delivery of reporting packs. Title: Civil & Geotech
Description: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Civil & Geotechnical Engineer to join our infrastructure and construction team. The ideal candidate will have experience in soil investigations, foundation design, and construction project planning. You will be responsible for analyzing subsurface conditions, designing geotechnical systems, and providing technical guidance during project execution to ensure structural safety and performance. Key Responsibilities Conduct geotechnical investigations, including soil sampling, borehole drilling, and laboratory testing. Analyze soil and rock properties to determine the suitability for foundations, slopes, retaining walls, tunnels, and earthworks. Design foundations (shallow, deep, pile, raft), ground improvement techniques, and slope stabilization measures. Collaborate with civil and structural engineers to integrate geotechnical solutions into overall project designs. Prepare geotechnical reports, design calculations, and construction drawings. Monitor on-site construction activities to ensure adherence to geotechnical design specifications. Perform risk assessments for geotechnical hazards such as liquefaction, landslides, or settlement. Liaise with contractors, consultants, and clients to provide technical support during design and construction. Ensure compliance with local codes, environmental standards, and safety regulations. Utilize software such as PLAXIS, GeoStudio, STAAD, AutoCAD, and MS Project for analysis and reporting. Qualifications Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Civil Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, or a related field. 7–10 years of relevant experience in geotechnical and civil engineering roles. Strong knowledge of soil mechanics, foundation engineering, and ground improvement techniques. Familiarity with IS codes, ASTM standards, and international geotechnical practices. Excellent analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills Preferred Skills Experience with underground metro, tunneling, or infrastructure projects. Knowledge of site investigation planning and instrumentation monitoring. Project management and client coordination experience.

Title: Lead Civil
Description: Title - Lead Civil Location - Jamnagar, Gujarat Purpose of Role: To lead and oversee all civil and structural works for the AI/Data Centre project, ensuring the development of high-performance, resilient, and sustainable infrastructure to support advanced computing environments. The Lead Civil is responsible for the safe, timely, and cost-effective delivery of civil works in compliance with Data Center design standards, project specifications, and industry best practices. The role provides technical leadership and coordination across design, construction, and commissioning phases, ensuring seamless integration of civil systems with mechanical and electrical infrastructure critical to AI/Data Centre operations. Responsibilities: 1. Lead the planning, design review, and execution of civil and structural works specific to data centre infrastructure (e.g., foundations, superstructures, drainage, and external works). 2. Coordinate with architectural, mechanical and electrical teams to ensure alignment of civil works with data centre layouts, equipment loads, and cooling system requirements. 3. Review design drawings, specifications, and method statements to ensure compliance with data centre standards and local regulations. 4. Supervise and monitor construction activities, ensuring adherence to quality, safety, and environmental standards. 5. Implement robust QA/QC procedures to maintain high construction precision and reliability suited to mission-critical environments. 6. Ensure civil works integrate seamlessly with underground utilities, cable routes, and site access for data centre operations and maintenance. 7. Manage contractors and subcontractors, providing clear direction, technical oversight, and performance evaluations. 8. Monitor project progress, budgets, and schedules, proactively identifying and mitigating risks or delays. 9. Support value engineering, sustainability, and energy efficiency initiatives in civil design and execution.

Title: Engineer
Description: We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Engineer to join our Railway Design Team, specializing in alignment, track, and structural engineering. The role involves assisting in the preparation of railway alignment designs, geometric layouts, trackwork planning, and structural detailing under the guidance of senior engineers. Responsibilities include developing CAD drawings, preparing design reports, coordinating with multidisciplinary teams, supporting site teams with design clarifications, and ensuring compliance with railway standards (Indian Railways, RDSO, AREMA, UIC, or FIDIC). The candidate should possess a basic understanding of the design of civil structures such as bridges, viaducts, and culverts, along with knowledge of geotechnical investigations (GTI) and embankment design for railway formation. Exposure to slab track and ballasted track systems, drainage concepts, and interface requirements will be an added advantage. Strong analytical skills, proficiency in design software (AutoCAD, Civil 3D, STAAD, or similar), and the ability to interpret technical specifications are essential. This role provides excellent opportunities to learn advanced railway engineering practices, gain hands-on project experience, and build a strong foundation for a career in large-scale rail and metro infrastructure projects.

Title: Engineer Maintenance- Mechanical
Description: Job Description Job Role: Engineer Maintenance Mechanical Job Role ID SECTION I: BASIC INFORMATION ABOUT THE JOB ROLE Job Role Variant: Engineer Maintenance - Mechanical Manager Job Position: Lead Plant Maintenance Job Position ID Value Stream: Asset Operations Job Family: Manufacturing Sub-Job Family: Maintenance Grade/Level Location: SECTION II: PURPOSE OF THE ROLE To support overall reliability and integrity of all mechanical equipment in plant, and oversee & perform all predictive and preventive mechanical maintenance activities in order to ensure availability of equipment while adhering to RIL policies, safety guidelines, and allocated budgets. SECTION III: KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES OF THE ROLE Responsibilities Policies, Processes and Procedures Conduct day to day mechanical maintenance activities & follow all relevant policies, processes, standard operating procedures and instructions so that work is carried out in a controlled and consistent manner Keep self abreast with leading practices & trends in mechanical maintenance and contribute to the identification of continuous improvement of systems, processes and procedures Maintenance Planning & Review Support in creating preventive and predictive maintenance schedule at daily, weekly and monthly level for the mechanical activities, in coordination with Production, Technology and CES teams Create the resourcing plan as per the maintenance schedule in order to handle day-to-day mechanical maintenance activities as well as shutdown jobs as per plan Collate mechanical discipline data for performance monitoring and prepare information report detailing out performance against KPIs of mechanical maintenance, take corrective actions and present the same to the lead maintenance in case of any escalations Create a plan for inventory control activities of mechanical spares and get it approved to ensure effective maintenance operations; issue spares for job execution as and when required Assist discipline manager with spares identification for procurement; follow up with vendor, purchase, and stores to ensure availability of the spares Assist in preparing mechanical maintenance cost and budgeting process, and analyse the same to ensure efficient utilization Maintenance Operations Execute as well as supervise mechanical maintenance task with quality and safety; ensure timely completion of tasks in adherence to standards, procedures and best practices Manage preventive and corrective mechanical maintenance of plant machinery in order to minimize production/ quality loss Analyse the current condition of the equipment, and monitor its performance trends to identify irregularities so as to rectify the same & ensure improvement in availability of equipment Carry out preservation activities as per schedule to ensure performance, functionality, as well as availability of the equipment's, assets etc. Manage the execution of shutdown jobs as per schedule to ensure timely completion Carry out regular look, listen, and feel (LLF) visits in the plant to identify potential failures, and suggest measures to rectify the same if any Identify issues jointly with Production, Quality, CES, EHS, and Technology teams, collect inputs and implement suggested measures to enhance plant health Conduct troubleshooting and root cause analysis (RCA) as an when required in coordination with CES team for technical support Maintain integrated management system (IMS) documents for mechanical maintenance to ensure repository of records for review and audit purposes Participate in reliability & integrity studies of mechanical systems and components as identified to ensure their safe and reliable operations Maintain integrity of maintenance with SAP PM and SAP MM data, analysis and costs by ensuring timely and correct data entries (such as pending jobs etc.) and validations Liaison with workshop team for repair activities so as to ensure timely completion of maintenance activities Facilitate and support minor projects activities as and when required Workplace Safety & Environment Follow maintenance related safety, fire and environmental processes and compliance norms and ensure all operations align with the same in order to provide safe working environment to all plant personnel's Oversee plant machinery for safety, fire and environmental issues/ hazards pertaining to mechanical maintenance operations, identify root cause and take appropriate steps to mitigate any challenges Investigate safety incidents along with safety teams pertaining to mechanical operations, support in drafting action plan and implement the same to ensure non-recurrence Assist in emergency operations in case of any safety or fire incidents to ensure quick closure Compliance & Audits Prepare reports/ documents pertaining to audits. Assist lead maintenance with audits, and support implementation of the finalized measures Support in ensuring timely adherence to audit schedules; implement suggestive corrective actions in case of any deviation Assist with HSEF compliance (RESOP, MIQA, CFA, DOSHE mandatory trainings) and support in implementing suggested action plan to enable a safe working culture Coordinate and monitor the contractor's activities to ensure compliance with established policies and procedures Ensure compliance of mandatory trainings to ensure adherence to established policies and processes SECTION IV: SUCCESS METRICS Time to resolution - % reduction in obsolescence of critical equipment - OEE (Overall equipment effectiveness) - Reduction in unplanned shutdown - Shutdown turn around time/ Mean time between failures - Automation index - Adherence to health & safety policies SECTION V: OPERATING NETWORK Internal: CES, HSEF, Production, Warehouse, HR, Finance, etc. External: Vendors, Contractors, Equipment Supplier, etc. SECTION VI: KNOWLEDGE AND COMPETENCIES Education Qualifications Full Time Diploma/ Engineering (Mechanical) Experience 2-5 years of maintenance experience at plant; Functional / Behavioural competencies required to execute the role Functional Competencies Knowledge of various codes & standards - Understanding of Mechanical equipment's periodic, proactive, & shutdown maintenance - Ability to repair mechanical equipment's & refurbishment - Troubleshooting & analysis - Turnaround & shutdown coordination - Contractor management - Health and safety

Title: Contracts Engineer (Mechanical)
Description: SECTION I: BASIC INFORMATION ABOUT THE JOB ROLE Job Role Variant: Contracts Engineer Value Stream: Money, Materials & Compliance Job Family: Procurement & Contracts Sub-Job Family: Procurement & Contracts SECTION II: PURPOSE OF THE ROLE To support the end-to-end contract lifecycle execution i.e. pre and post-award management by understanding requirements, identifying pre qualified vendors, tender preparation, inviting bids, technical & commercial negotiation in line with RIL standards aligned to Procurement & Contracting (P&C) objectives and guidelines SECTION III: KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES OF THE ROLE Responsibilities Pre- Award Management Assist Category / Contract Manager in sourcing of critical contracts by selection and evaluation of vendors; find target vendors based on brief of package, planning for assigned items as per the target timelines, and preparation of contracting plan in compliance with agreed terms and conditions Support the thorough pre-qualification of vendors by specifying sourcing events, conducting technical validation with help from internal stakeholders Develop Internal Cost Estimates as per defined procedures and processes Float RFQ via the digital RFX systems and arrange RFQ clarification meetings as required Study offers from vendors, and prepare a comparative statement to aid in selection of vendors, optimization of price and other commercial terms Participate in commercial negotiation meetings, negotiate and finalize price as per scope given Highlight any major commercial or contractual risks or issues to the relevant authority and work on developing optimum solution as per Contract procedures and standards Focus on usage of technological tools like e-auction and reverse auction to improve efficiency and transparency Ensure generation of Purchase Order (PO) as per established procedures & processes Use the SAP system optimally to drive efficiency and cost optimization Post-Award Management Set up Kick-Off Meeting (KOM) with internal stakeholders and vendors Ensure timely expedition for mobilisation of resources as per contract requirements and attend periodic progress review meetings Participate in vendor sites visits to ensure compliance with agreed contractual terms & conditions Gather feedback from contractor, expediting team, and supplier to identify areas of improvements and implement resolutions as per plan Implement change management processes effectively as per set guidelines, procedures and standards and seek approval for extension of time, and variation in quantity Coordinate with internal stakeholders i.e., project engineers, plant engineers FC&A for resolution of issues as performance security payments, GST queries etc. Review received claims and submit to Engineer In Charge (EIC), arrange various meetings, coordination for documentation as required to ensure timely settlement of claims Identify possible areas of dispute amongst the vendors, contractor(s) take the necessary proactive measures as per the established procedures and guidelines Supplier Relationship Engage with vendors on a regular basis to share organizational requirements and work on the identified constraints Gather feedback from Engineer In-Charge (EIC) and supplier, analyse the feedback and share consolidated reports to Project Category Manager and respective Contracts Lead to ensure system of continuous improvement Ensure vendor performance as per end-user needs, identify areas of improvements, and share recommendations with Contract Manager as per overall goals and objectives Policies, Processes and Procedures Support the Contract Manager in creating the Procurement Strategy & supporting in execution of overall contracts plan Conduct day-to-day contract activities and follow all relevant policies, processes, standard operating procedures and instructions so that contract work is carried out in a consistent and controlled manner Keep self abreast with leading practices, market trends, market suppliers and contribute to the identification of continuous improvement of procurement systems, processes and procedures SECTION IV: SUCCESS METRICS Ordering of contracts within timeline & approved budget - Change Management within stipulated timelines - Claims Management - Major Ordering through ARC (Annual Rate Contracts) - Applicable for O&M Team only SECTION V: OPERATING NETWORK Internal: - P&C, Construction Managers, Project Management Team, FC&A,HR & IR, Engineering Teams, Legal External: - Vendors, Consultants SECTION VI: KNOWLEDGE AND COMPETENCIES Education Qualifications Bachelor in Engineering or Technology in Mechanical - Masters in Business Administration (Desirable) Experience 1 to 3 years of experience in construction, operations, maintenance, exploration sites or similar field Functional / Behavioural Competencies Required To Execute The Role Functional Competencies Techno-commercial acumen - Knowledge of Cost Estimation - Market Intelligence - Knowledge of working on platforms as SAP or equivalent - Legal understanding of contractual terms Behavioral Competencies NA SECTION VII: CAREER MOVEMENTS Feeder Roles Graduate Engineer Trainee Possible Next Role Movement Sr. Contracts Engineer

Title: Mechanical Engineer
Description: Equipment & Plant Layout / Piping Layouts for Process Plants, Power Plants, Chemical, Oil, Gas, Petrochemical Plants, Basic and detailed engineering. Static Equipment /Shell & Tube Heat Exchangers/Pressure Vessels/Tankages/Piping Layouts & Isometrics Detailed Engineering of Plants, Equipment, Systems, Terminal Points Interfacing Static & Rotary Equipment Spec. preparation & Vendor offer evaluation/engineering Packaged Systems - Water & Effluent Treatment, Desalination, ZLD, Cooling Towers, Chilling Systems/HVAC/Fire Fighting Shall have good understanding of complex plant layouts, equipment disposition, Piping and Utilities Systems Shall have experience and skills on plant detailed engineering Knowledge of codes and standards like ASME, HTRI, API, OISD, IBR, IS, ISO etc. Review of drawings of layouts, equipment, piping, pressure vessels, tanks, packaged bought out systems. Prepare/review specifications for packaged systems and equipment like pumps, compressors, PHE, cooling towers, water treatment, HVAC, Fire Fighting Equipment loading, handling, stress analysis, foundation loads, modularization concepts for equipment and piping skids Shall have instrumentation and electrical interface of mechanical systems Autocad, E3D, PDMS, Smart Plant, PLM, Engg. Document Control

Title: Engineer, Manufacturing
Description: Introduction: A Career at HARMAN Automotive We’re a global, multi-disciplinary team that’s putting the innovative power of technology to work and transforming tomorrow. At HARMAN Automotive, we give you the keys to fast-track your career. Engineer audio systems and integrated technology platforms that augment the driving experience. Combine ingenuity, in-depth research, and a spirit of collaboration with design and engineering excellence. Advance in-vehicle infotainment, safety, efficiency, and enjoyment. About The Role An equipment engineer designs, develops, tests, installs, and maintains mechanical, electrical, and pneumatic equipment to ensure efficient and safe operation across industries like manufacturing, construction, and mining. Key responsibilities include creating design schematics, troubleshooting technical issues, developing maintenance schedules, ensuring regulatory compliance, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to optimize equipment performance and minimize downtime. What You Will Do: Troubleshooting & debugging of Assembly station during breakdown is the prior goal Adherence to Assembly station, preventive maintenance according to PM schedule and PM procedure. Maintain the MTTR, OEM, FTT Spare list etc… according to Industry standard Verifying & Validation of Poke yoke systems & line improvements. Maintain all document check list like Preventive, Predictive, Contingency plan, Critical equipment list, other check list etc. What You Need To Be Successful All running machine need to understand & debug Adhere to all safety and health rules and regulations associated with this position and as directed by supervisor Comply and follow all procedures within the company security policy What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 50%, domestic only. This role is eligible to work at Harman Pune Plant office. What We Offer Work in international teams with the biggest worldwide automotive customer. Training on the job and extensive technical training Further career development opportunities A great package of additional benefits, such as: o Flexible working time o Free parking spaces o Employee discounts on our HARMAN products (JBL, AKG, HARMAN Kardon)

Title: Fashion Consultant
Description: Company Overview Reliance Retail is India's largest and fastest-growing retailer, known for its diversified omni-channel presence through integrated store concepts, digital, and new commerce platforms. With a mission to revolutionize retail in India, Reliance Retail has perfected its capabilities across people, processes, and technology. Catering to over 193 million customers across the country, it offers superior quality products and an unmatched shopping experience in Consumer Electronics, Fashion & Lifestyle, and more. Job Overview We are seeking an experienced Fashion Consultant to join our team at Reliance Retail. As an Executive, you will be based in either Delhi or Mumbai, working full-time. The ideal candidate will have between 1 to 3 years of experience in the retail fashion industry, with a strong understanding of store operations, designer brands, and customer relations. You will provide expert styling advice and foster a luxurious customer experience. Qualifications And Skills Possess between 1 to 3 years of professional experience in the fashion industry with a deep understanding of retail operations. Demonstrated expertise in luxury and designer fashion brands and ability to adapt to new fashion trends quickly. Strong ability to provide personalized styling advice, enhancing the customer's shopping experience effectively. Excellent customer relation management skills with a focus on building long-lasting client relationships. Proficiency in managing store operations and ensuring seamless retail activities. Ability to act as a sales consultant with strong persuasive skills to drive sales and achieve targets. Must have a keen eye for fashion trends and the ability to incorporate them into a personalized customer shopping experience. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with diverse clientele and internal teams. Roles And Responsibilities Provide personalized fashion advice and recommendations tailored to the clients preferences and lifestyle. Assist customers in making the right choice of clothing and accessories to enhance their personal style. Maintain knowledge of current fashion trends and leverage this information to benefit customers and the store. Manage and maintain effective store operations to ensure a high-quality customer experience. Build long-term relationships with clients, enhancing customer loyalty and increasing repeat business. Collaborate with the store team to achieve sales targets and other business objectives. Conduct market research to identify fashion industry trends and consumer preferences. Provide feedback to the buying and merchandising teams about customer preferences and trends.

Title: Fashion Designer, Menswear, Knitwear
Description: Company Overview Reliance Retail, India's largest and most profitable retailer, offers an omni-channel presence with integrated store concepts and digital platforms. Since its inception in 2006, the company has focused on providing value through high-quality products and outstanding shopping experiences. Its expansive reach includes over 15,000 stores across 7,000+ cities, supported by a strong supply chain and workforce. Headquartered in Mumbai, Reliance Retail excels in categories including Fashion & Lifestyle. Job Overview We are seeking a talented Senior Fashion Designer specializing in Menswear Knitwear to join our team in Kolkata. This is a full-time position within our Fashion & Lifestyle division. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing innovative and sustainable menswear knitwear collections that align with market trends and branding standards. This role requires a strong blend of technical design skills and creative vision. Qualifications And Skills Proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Textile Design, and Sustainable Fashion Practices (Mandatory skill). Expert to visualize ideas adeptly. Strong skills in pattern making to ensure the precision and quality of knitwear garments. Exceptional ability in fashion sketching for translating design concepts into visual representations. Ability to conduct comprehensive trend analysis to keep designs current and competitive. Proficient in technical garment construction with a focus on knitwear materials and techniques. Understanding of sustainable fashion practices to integrate eco-friendly processes in design. Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Graduate from top design institute or college. Roles And Responsibilities Design and develop cutting-edge menswear, knitwear collections that adhere to brand aesthetics and market demands. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including merchandising, production, and marketing to ensure successful collection launches. Create mood boards and conceptual drawings to illustrate design inspiration and direction. Perform market research to identify new fashion trends, fabrics, and techniques for innovative designs. Sketch preliminary and detailed design ideas, and transform them into prototype garments. Review samples and perform necessary modifications to achieve desired design outcomes. Ensure all designs align with sustainable fashion goals and utilize eco-friendly materials when possible. Present collections to stakeholders with clear justifications for design choices, fabric selections, and final ensembles. Follow the instructions to develop tech-packs, trims collection, pattern making, khakas for embroidery and print files for smooth handover to Production team.

Title: Fashion Designer
Description: Role Overview: We are seeking a highly creative and experienced Senior Fashion Designer for GlobalDesi to lead the design direction for key collections. This role demands a deep understanding of global fashion trends, Indian textile sensibilities, and the ability to create commercially successful collections that resonate with our target audience. Key Responsibilities: Seasonal Collection Development: Conceptualize and develop seasonal collections in line with the brand’s design philosophy, customer profile, and market trends. Trend Research & Forecasting: C onduct thorough research on global fashion trends, fabrics, silhouettes, trims, and colors to ensure the brand stays relevant and aspirational. Design Execution: Translate concepts into detailed sketches and tech packs; oversee sample development, ensuring alignment with design vision and commercial viability. Collaboration: Work closely with the sampling, sourcing, print, and production teams to ensure timely and accurate execution. Print & Surface Development: Collaborate with print designers to develop original prints and embroideries in line with seasonal themes. Presentation & Reviews: Prepare mood boards, collection stories, and presentations for internal reviews, trade shows, and marketing collaborations. Qualifications & Experience: Degree/Diploma in Fashion Design from a reputed institute. 4+ years of experience in women’s fashion design, with at least 3 years in a senior/lead role. Strong background in Indian and Indo-western wear, especially with fusion silhouettes, prints, and ethnic influences. Proficient in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, CorelDRAW, and Microsoft Office. Hands-on experience with fabric sourcing, print development, and vendor coordination. Interested candidates can send their resumes to anushka.bothra@houseofanitadongre.com with subject line "Fashion Designer - Global Desi"

Title: Fashion Design Internship in Mumbai
Company: De Elite Multi Desinger Fashion Studio
Description: Are you a creative and passionate individual looking to kickstart your career in the fashion industry? De Elite Multi Designer Fashion Studio is seeking a talented Fashion Design intern to join our team! As an intern, you will have the opportunity to work alongside experienced designers and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Key Responsibilities Assist in creating fashion illustrations and designs using Adobe Photoshop, CorelDRAW, and Adobe Illustrator Collaborate with the design team to develop new concepts and collections Participate in fabric sourcing, trend research, and fashion styling Assist in fittings and garment construction for prototypes Support the team in preparing for fashion shows and photo shoots Help with social media content creation and marketing initiatives Contribute fresh ideas and creative input to design projects If you have a strong eye for detail, a passion for fashion, and excellent skills in Adobe Photoshop, Fashion Designing, CorelDRAW, Adobe Illustrator, Fashion illustration, and Fashion Styling, we want to hear from you! Don't miss this opportunity to gain valuable experience and make your mark in the fashion industry. Apply now and unleash your creativity with De Elite Multi Designer Fashion Studio! About Company: We are a multi-designer fashion studio located in Chembur, Tilak Nagar, Mumbai. Our company is 11 year old and initially started with 4 designers, and we are now associated with more than 75 different designers and fashion brands. We give a chance to new budding designers to display their collections in the studio. The idea is to train and develop new talents and put them in the world collection range from chic to classic to contemporary. Apart from the number of designers, the studio also has extended its line to accessories, bags, shoes, and jewelry.

Title: Senior Designer - Women's active wear
Description: In your role, you will drive the design strategy for women’s wear, creating compelling collections that align with the business vision. You’ll lead the creative process, oversee the development of seasonal prints and graphics, and collaborate closely with various teams to ensure successful product launches. Your innovative approach and attention to detail will be crucial in articulating design concepts and fit specifications. Responsibilities ● Strategic Alignment : Align design initiatives with the business vision for womenswear, ensuring they support overall company goals. ● Design Development : Create unique design stories for new menswear collections and lead the development of seasonal prints and graphics. ● Sketching and Line Management : Drive the sketching of linesheets for seasonal collections in Running, Training, Yoga, and Athleisure, conveying the collection's narrative. ● Innovative Problem Solving : Introduce innovative design solutions and consumer-driven ideas to enhance product development. ● Cost Optimization : Maintain cost efficiency by optimizing the use of raw materials, keeping color and material minimums in mind. ● Presentation and Articulation : Present visually appealing collection swatches, trims, and mock-ups during line reviews, articulating technical specifications for sourcing teams. ● Fit Development : Conduct fit articulation using market samples, ensuring proper execution with appropriate materials and weights. ● Collaboration and Representation : Act as the design spokesperson in meetings, collaborating closely with fit techs, sourcing teams, and merchandisers to ensure alignment and success in product development. Qualifications ● Bachelor's degree in design, Fashion, and/or a relevant field of study, preferably Knitwear design. Passionate about sport and sportswear design. ● Expertise in Women’s categories and lead creative direction for print and graphics ● Minimum of 7-8 years of relevant experience in the fashion, active wear, sportswear, or teamsport space, specializing in Apparel. ● Experience directly leading a small design team is a strong advantage. ● Proficiency and refinement in all stages of presentation, from concept to final design review. ● Broad knowledge of apparel manufacturing and prototype making. ● Strong knowledge of fabrics, with knowledge of graphics being ideal. ● Strong MAC, CAD, and analytical skills, with 3D knowledge being an advantage.

Title: Fashion Stylist
Description: Games2win Introduction: Games2win is a leading global mobile games publisher. Our games have over 500 million downloads and are played by over 10 million monthly active players. We take pride in building our own Intellectual Property (IP) and using the strength of our consumer love to market our games! That’s why most of our downloads are generated without advertising support or paid installations. A few of our global hit titles are Driving Academy, Decisions, International Fashion Stylist, and many more. To learn more about us, visit https://games2winmedia.com/company-profile/ Objective of the Role: Games2win’s fashion games are highly successful and have proven to be very popular with our users globally. Our focus is mainly female audiences, aged 18-25, based in the US and Europe. We want to be sure that the content available in our games is relevant to our users and matches the latest in fashion. Top 3 games from Games2win’s fashion portfolio: International Fashion Stylist : Android /  iOS Super Wedding Stylist: Android / iOS Decisions: Android / iOS Role: Fashion Stylist Location: Mumbai Reporting to: Fashion Lead Experience Required: 1+ yrs What do you need to do? (Role and Responsibilities) We need an industry expert to audit the fashion and styling showcased in our games Create new levels and content for both games Provide Insights of reference looks for game characters following fashion trends and styling Mentor teams on Fashion as they are limited by the content available on websites which are to the best of their knowledge and understanding Keep up to date with trends in fashion Provide the latest trends in fashion to stay relevant for Our games Give insights on Competitor games in the market which are extremely successful and have brand collaborations What do you(candidate) need to do? (Role and Responsibilities) We need an industry expert to audit the fashion and styling showcased in our games We add special events every week: Create new levels and content for all our dress-up & narrative games: International Fashion Stylist, Super Wedding Stylist & Decisions. Provide Insights of reference looks for game characters following fashion trends and styling Mentor teams on Fashion as they are limited by the content available to us in the form of PNGs & help us re-imagine using AI tools. Trend Forecasting & keeping up to date with the latest trends/themes. Pricing the items after they are ready to go in the game. Give insights on Competitor games in the market that are extremely successful and have brand collaborations. Manage inventory as we have around 50000+ assets in the game & we keep on adding more. Create PPTs for every special event,chapter or theme you add content(clothes/accessories/shoes/makeup/backgrounds) for. Sourcing Backgrounds as they are a major part of our game. Collaborate with our artists to provide feedback for the creation of our content.

Title: Fashion Stylist
Description: Job Description Oversee the coordination between designer/tailors/boutiques and customer service team to ensure timely production and delivery of high-quality apparel. Provide expert advice and suggestions to shoppers on fitting options and measurements, both virtually through online platforms and in-person consultations. Create detailed flat sketches of apparel designs using design software or by hand, ensuring accuracy and clarity in conveying design elements. Identify and onboard talented designers, skilled tailors, and boutique partners onto our platform. Nurture strong relationships with designers, tailors, and boutiques to foster collaboration and ensure a diverse range of offerings for our shoppers. Skills:- Design thinking

Title: Senior Designer Footwear
Description: Company Overview Reliance Retail, established in 2006, is India's largest and fastest-growing retail giant with a diversified omni-channel presence across integrated store concepts and digital platforms. With over 15,000 stores, it serves a vast customer base, offering superior quality products and an exceptional shopping experience. Leveraging its strong supply chain, technology, and a skilled workforce, Reliance Retail continuously innovates and grows through strategic partnerships, enhancing its presence in various sectors including fashion and lifestyle. Job Overview We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Designer Footwear to join our dynamic team at Reliance Retail, located in Bangalore Urban. This full-time role requires expertise in designing and developing footwear with a focus on sports shoes. The ideal candidate should possess experience in fitting, line sheet development, and sample development and will play a key role in conceptualizing innovative designs and improving existing footwear lines. Title: Assistant Manager - Fashion Designer [Menswear]
Description: About us: The Souled Store is a homegrown youth casual-wear brand started in 2013. We are one of India’s largest online merchandising platforms with licenses like Disney, Warner Bros., WWE, IPL, Viacom18 to name a few. Apart from selling products with themed designs such as superheroes, movies, TV shows, and cartoons, the brand also is at the forefront of the latest youth style and fashion trends. In addition to core men and women wear apparel categories, we are also in the process of expanding to new categories and introducing new product lines in the existing categories like activewear, supima products, innerwear, personal care products like perfumes and very recently launched footwear and kidswear. Although we are primarily an online brand, we’ve expanded in the offline retail space as well and have 40 offline stores and further expansion in pan India. The Souled Store was born out of the idea of loving what you do, from the soul. We believe that people do their best work when they love what they do. There are too many Monday mornings and you can’t go dreading every single one of them. Over the years, we have built a strong team of like-minded people that work smart, own their work, and think like leaders. If you identify with what we do and are interested in being a part of an aggressively growing brand, we would love to have you on board. Key Responsibilities ● Lead the end-to-end design & development process for premium smart formals and casual menswear collections - from research, concept creation, and sketching to final product prototyping. ● Drive seasonal trend research, consumer insights, and competitive analysis to identify key opportunities and translate them into commercially viable collections aligned with the brand’s aesthetic. ● Guide and mentor associate designers and interns, providing creative direction, feedback, and ensuring alignment to timelines and brand DNA. ● Oversee the creation of accurate tech packs, including detailed sketches, construction details, and measurement specs for sampling and production. ● Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - sourcing, production, marketing, and merchandising - to ensure timely execution and quality output. ● Evaluate and finalize fabric, trims, and surface development, ensuring both design intent and cost-effectiveness are met. ● Lead fit sessions and sampling reviews, providing clear actionable feedback to vendors and internal teams to maintain quality and design integrity. ● Prepare and present seasonal design boards, storylines, and collection decks to leadership and cross-functional stakeholders. ● Ensure all design documentation, CADs, and files are well-organized and updated for easy reference and future use. ● Contribute to process improvements, bringing in new ideas, techniques, or tools to streamline development and enhance design output. Requirements ● Bachelor’s degree in Fashion Design or a related field. ● 4-6 years of relevant experience in fashion design, with a strong focus on menswear. ● Proven experience in leading or co-leading seasonal collections from concept to production. ● Strong sketching, illustration, and CAD skills. ● Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator). ● Solid understanding of garment construction, patternmaking, textiles, and production methods. ● Excellent communication, team leadership, and stakeholder management skills. ● Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment while meeting deadlines. Nice to Have ● Experience working with 3D design software such as CLO or Browzwear. ● Exposure to sustainable materials and design practices. ● Prior experience working in a fast-scaling, youth-centric fashion brand. Note : Our hiring team will review your application and should we find your background to be a fit for this role, we will be in touch . If you don't get a response from our team within seven days, please know that your profile may not be a match for our current requirements. However, we appreciate your interest and encourage you to explore future opportunities with us :)

Title: Information Security Engineer
Description: Operational security automation is the process of automating some or all aspects of SOC or VOC operations. Replacing manual workflows with automated ones. A fundamental building block of automation is the security playbook. A playbook defines a workflow by outlining the steps teams will take to handle different types of security alerts or events. By developing playbooks ahead of time, teams avoid having to make a response plan every time an alert or event occurs. Responsibilities: Scripting and workflow development, follow proper engineering and integration lifecycles (design, create, test, document, integrate, monitor, maintain) and are designed to be reusable. Experience with agile project management processes and methodologies Mandatory 3 years experiences with one of the following SOAR vendor platforms (Tines, Swimlane) Being autonomous. Advanced research, analytical, and problem-solving skills Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field

Title: Associate Manager Internal Audit
Description: Role : Associate Manager Internal Audit Location : Bangalore Key Responsibilities Financial Outcomes: Responsible for execution and driving internal audits in commodity sourcing and contribute in elevating process maturity around the areas of audit coverage in line with organizational goals. Support the Lead by executing and timely completing the Internal audits across various domestic and international operations and business segments. Identify cost saving opportunities by streamlining the process and benchmarking against industry leading practices Identifying areas for regular sensitization to promote and maintain a healthy control environment. During the audit execution, assess the process design and control effectiveness in achieving business objectives. Identify, document weaknesses, and findings with evidence. Take lead in developing risk analytics and dashboards for sustainable improvement and business partnering. Support in executing special assignments based on outcomes of the audit, business need/request to help organization in strengthening controls, improve processes. Customer Service: Proactively identify and highlight challenges and conflicts during audits execution. Suggest process improvements focusing on automation and digitization opportunities. Undertake vendor site visits / market visits to gain insights on vendor practices. Monitoring of various regulations impacting sourcing including sustainability requirements Work with audit lead and business on pending audit actions to ensure timely implementation of audit recommendation and agreed action plans. Engage with low to middle management for business in aligning the audit observations, taking their inputs to enhance correctness and quality of observation. Provide industry-based insights to the stakeholders, during the discussion for better clarity on process gaps, observations, issues etc. Internal Process: Draft quality reports with clear recommendations, specific action plans, and concise reporting. Work alongside with co-sourcing and in-house teams to deliver the engagement. Embed audit inputs from CIA and audit lead, ensure comprehensive audit coverage, robust test procedures, and quality observations. Ensure audit progress in line with agreed scope document to execution and provide regular updates. Proactively highlight challenges for timely audit completion in line with agreed timelines. Propose practical and value-added recommendations to address control weaknesses and/or process inefficiencies. Ensure factual accuracy of observations and alignments with business. Plan and conduct meetings with auditee at the end of fieldwork, providing clear explanations. Assist in benchmarking processes with peer FMCG companies to identify improvement areas and best practices. Innovation and Learning: Support and develop need-based analytics on TGO platform for Internal audit as well as for business on control related aspects. Attend the trainings suggested by the audit leads and focus on professional development agenda. Collaborate with other audit leads to share best practices and improve audit quality. Foster a culture of training to enhance knowledge on covered domains and risk factors. Critical Success Factors At least2-3 years of work experience, preferably in the FMCG industry or Big 4 / global consulting firms Possession of a reputable accounting or business degree, such as Chartered Accountant (CA) or ACCA (Association of Chartered Certified Accountants) Proficient in carrying out process audits around Agri commodity sourcing Working knowledge of SAP, procurement tools and Power BI / other data analytics tools Excellent communication skills for articulating complex concepts. Commitment to professional development and staying abreast with changes in the market.

Key Competencies & Attributes Strong command of spoken and written English. Excellent interpersonal and supervisory skills. Effective communicator across all organizational levels. Collaborative and able to lead cross-functional teams. Comfortable working with various financial software and systems. Ability to interpret airline operational manuals and apply financial insights.
